result.execSummary:
The defendant Kodi C. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kodi C. Olson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kodi C. Olson was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Kodi C. Olson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs (DNA surcharge is not ordered).
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Comply with any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kodi C. Olson

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular

08:34 AM Court calls the cases. 
Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent P. Grabow is present in court. 
Both files heard: 15CF468, 16CF277

Court questions Agent Grabow. 
Court questions the defendant regarding his community service. 
Defendant indicates he has completed 2 hours of community service.  He was supposed to be doing 4 more but had to work late.  He hopes to have all his community service hours by April 7th, 2019.  
Defendant questions the court regarding his land lord owning a water pump place.  He has had a seizure so he's been helping him shovel out the driveways.  Asks to be able to have his land lord sign off on some of those as community service hours.
State does not object. 
BY THE COURT: Court will allow him to do up to 10 hours of credit for that purpose.
Court has determined that the Defendant is not indigent and therefore will not be appointing counsel
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on March 5, 2019 at 08:30 am.

03:40 PM Court calls the case. 
Both files heard: 15CF468, 16CF277
Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent Patricia Grabow is also present. 

Court received a letter from the agent.  Defendant failed to complete conditions.  The defendant owes fines and costs.  He has failed to complete any community service and has not been able to maintain employment. 
Just before 3:00 p.m. the defendant provided a petition for appointment of counsel and has indicated he was denied by the public defender but has failed to include the denial letter that is required. He also failed to complete the income of the household.  He just obtained a job at QPS.  
Court questions the defendant regarding his mothers income. 

BY THE COURT:  Court does not find the defendant indigent and will not be appointing counsel. 

Court questions the defendant further. 
Defendant indicates he provided probation and parole a money order on Friday.  He filled out paperwork to do community service at the Humane Society and Parks Department and neither of them have gotten back to him.  He has tried everywhere.   
Defendant wants an attorney present before he will speak. 

Court adjourns the matter to allow the defendant to obtain counsel. 
  Review hearing scheduled for March 5, 2019 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kodi C. Olson in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF468 & 16CF277.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.   Expungement for 16CF277 only.  No expungement offer on 15CF468.
Attorney for Defendant & Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Makes additional statements. 

16CF277 INITIAL APPEARANCE & WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court amends the complaint to read "felony". 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

State files information. 
Atty McFarland received a copy of the information. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF277 - NO CONTEST
15CF468 Counts 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF277 and 15CF468 Counts 4 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF468 Counts 1 & 2 dismissed and read-in.
15CF468 Count 3 Dismissed Outright.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF468 Counts 4 & 5 - 
Serve 90 days jail on each count - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Comply with any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Pay costs (DNA surcharge is not ordered). 

16CF277 Count 1 - 
Serve 6 months, consecutive to the jail imposed in 15CF468. - STAYED -
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent with 15CF468:
Same conditions as 15CF468.
Serve 30 days jail.
6 days credit. 
Allowed to serve the remainder on Electronic Monitoring if he qualifies after an assessment has been done by jail staff. 
Huber for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
Perform 40 hours of community service.   To be done with the Portage County Parks Department if at all possible. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide DNA sample. 
Court will grant expungment if defendant meets all conditions of probation and the agent recommends.

Defendant Kodi C. Olson appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:17 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states this is a warrant appearance.

Defendant was arrested yesterday afternoon.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant failed to appear at an initial appearance on Feb 8th.
Defendant states he moved 4 times within the last year, did not receive the notice.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint yesterday when he came in.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, requests bond to be set and an adjourned initial appearance be set.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding bond, cash bond with conditions.

Defendant states he is employed.

Court advises Defendant regarding counsel/public defender's office.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant to apply for representation from the public defender and to do so as soon as Defendant bonds out. 

Court advises Defendant if address changes, to contact the Clerk of Courts.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
